job_description:
Adform focuses on an exploration of a vast amount of online advertising data, development of predictive and segmentation models to optimize campaign strategy towards the most meaningful inventory, audience and ad, fraud detection, and many others. You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. If you are hands-on passionate, crazy about a development of advanced algorithms, machine learning, statistics, Hadoop, Python and SQL, have an ownership mindset, love to work in teams with smart, informal and open people, we’d love to get to know you! 

Our focus is Big Data, High Load and challenging experiences with understanding and taking advantage from data in Ad-Tech industry.
 


We hope you are ready to change the game! Be ready to:

Apply advanced machine learning/statistical algorithms scalable to huge data sets to: 
Determine the most meaningful ad, served to the right user at the optimal time, and the best price 
Identify behaviours, interests and segments of web users across billions of transactions to find the most optimal audience for a given advertising activity 
Eliminate suspicious / non-human traffic 
Maintenance our products, support customers in analysing the reasons behind the decisions made by our algorithms and look for new improvements in the process of striving for their excellence 
Work closely with other Data Scientists, development, and product teams to implement algorithms into production-level software. Mentor less experienced colleagues. 
Contribute to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions 
Be an active technical challenger in the team for the purpose of mutual improvement and broadening of team and company horizons 
Design solutions and lead cross-functional technical projects from ideation to deployment 


Attitude First. Everything else will follow. We can grow together faster if you have:

Minimum 1 year work experience in a similar senior position. Minimum 6 years experience in Data Science in total. 
Masters or PhD in a quantitative field such as Machine Learning, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or related. 
Excellent mathematical and statistical skills (statistical inference), experience in working with large datasets. Knowledge of data pipelines, ETL processes. 
Very good knowledge of multiply supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques with math background and hands-on experience 
Great problem-solving and analytical skills. 
Ability to structure a large business problem into tractable and reasonable components, design and deploy scalable machine learning solutions 
Proficiency in Python, SQL 
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hadoop)
Adform‘s guiding principles ingrained in your profile: Focus on Client Value, Behave with Decency, Take Ownership, Care, Collaborateas a TeamPlayer, Remain Ambitious, and StandTall inall interactions 


Stand out by having:

Knowledge of Ad Tech industry solutions 
Knowledge of web technologies 


Our promise to you:

You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. 
A dynamic, inspiring, and international environment filled with ambitious and caring colleagues
Premium health insurance with ₹10,00,000 coverage for you and your family
24 paid vacation days to enjoy life outside of work
Paid maternity (6 months) and paternity (2 weeks)
Annual learning budget to help you grow your skills and support continuous learning
Rewarding referral program for helping us grow
Global perks such as birthday gifts, work anniversaries, and company events to connect with colleagues and have fun
And much more – join us to explore the full experience


Diversity s Inclusion @Adform:

Adform is an equal opportunity employer with a global perspective. We remain committed to creating an environment that not only respects different backgrounds but celebrates them too. We believe that diversity in all its forms enhances our teams’ creativity, innovation, and effectiveness, and therefore we value different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
We are committed to creating a work environment where Adform employees feel valued for who they are and what they can contribute, free from any type of discrimination.

profile_data.headline: Jr. Machine Learning Engineer
profile_data.about:
Welcome to my world of AI-driven innovation and creativity!

As a Computer Science and Engineering graduate with a passion for Artificial Intelligence since 2017, I bring a fresh perspective to the dynamic world of technology. My journey began with a fascination for AI's potential to transform the way we interact with machines, and it quickly led me to specialize in Natural Language Processing and Generative AI.

Being a firm believer that communication is the key to success, I pride myself on my exceptional English communication skills, enabling me to bridge the gap between complex AI concepts and everyday conversations. I find joy in breaking down intricate technical jargon into accessible knowledge for everyone.

The ever-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence captivates me, and I am determined to be an active participant in its unfolding story. Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI is not just a habit; it's a passion that drives me to explore, experiment, and share my insights with the world.

Driven by a relentless pursuit of excellence, I approach every project with a result-oriented mindset. The thirst for knowledge and a hunger to learn new things quickly propels me forward, fueling my desire to make a meaningful impact in the AI domain.

When it comes to turning ideas into reality, I wield the power of Python programming and leverage data science libraries to create AI solutions that go beyond the ordinary. My technical proficiency and problem-solving skills empower me to take on challenges with confidence and innovation.

With boundless curiosity and a commitment to excellence, I am eager to forge ahead in the realm of Artificial Intelligence, making significant contributions that shape the future. Join me on this exciting journey as we push the boundaries of what AI can achieve and unlock the full potential of this remarkable technology together.

Let's embark on a transformative AI adventure – one where creativity, dedication, and limitless possibilities converge. Together, we will shape the future of AI and create a world where intelligent machines revolutionize our lives for the better.

description.text:
Immersed in cutting-edge technologies, I gained substantial knowledge and practical experience in generative AI, system design, and integration of complex APIs. Enhanced my technical prowess using Docker and AWS to develop scalable solutions in a dynamic start-up environment.

Spearheaded the development of an innovative application designed to optimize resumes for ATS compatibility. This tool automatically analyzes resumes, identifies deficiencies, queries users to fill gaps, and reformats the information into an enhanced, ATS-friendly format, significantly boosting job seekers' chances of landing interviews.

Created a smart, adaptive question-answering system tailored for major standardized tests including IELTS, TOEFL, GMAT, and GRE. The system evaluates user responses, pinpoints errors, and generates personalized reports offering detailed insights and strategies for improving both topic-specific skills and overall exam performance.

• Engaged in an intensive training program focusing on Java and SQL, gaining foundational knowledge and expertise in both areas.
• Successfully completed monthly milestone tests with 82 %, demonstrating consistent growth and understanding of key concepts.
• Collaborated with a diverse team of interns, sharing insights and learning from collective experiences
• Demonstrated commitment and adaptability by quickly adjusting to the dynamic learning environment and meeting all set milestones.
Abdul R  IGNITE Training Completion Certificate.pdf

keywords: The user's input "hey" is too vague to determine whether keyword extraction or missing keyword analysis is needed.  More information is required from the user to provide a relevant response.

messages.ai_response: Hello! How can I assist you with optimizing your LinkedIn profile today?

messages.user_query: Improve my profile so I can apply for Data Scientist role
messages.ai_response:
To make your LinkedIn profile shine for Data Scientist roles, let's focus on a few key areas.  First, update your headline.  Instead of "Jr. Machine Learning Engineer," try something like "Data Scientist | Machine Learning Expert | [Number] Years Experience,"  incorporating keywords like "Data Scientist" and quantifying your experience.  This will immediately grab recruiters' attention.

Next, let's revamp your experience section.  Instead of simply listing tasks, quantify your achievements using numbers and action verbs. For example, transform "Developed a system to monitor patient drip levels" into "Developed a real-time patient drip monitoring system using ultrasonic sensors, resulting in an 80% reduction in nursing staff time and improved patient safety."  This demonstrates the impact of your work.  Make sure to highlight any experience with ETL processes, data pipelines, and Big Data technologies like Hadoop and Spark, if applicable. The target role requires 6+ years of experience and 1+ year in a senior role; ensure your profile reflects this.

Your skills section needs a boost too.  Prioritize data science keywords such as Python, SQL, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and relevant libraries (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn).  List your most relevant skills first.  Consider adding keywords like "machine learning algorithms," "statistical inference," "supervised learning," and "unsupervised learning" to better align with job descriptions. If the specific Data Scientist role mentions Ad Tech, prominently feature any relevant experience.

Finally, remember the soft skills!  Highlight your teamwork and communication abilities, emphasizing your capacity to clearly explain complex technical information.  Adding recommendations and endorsements will further strengthen your profile.  By implementing these changes, you'll significantly increase your visibility to recruiters seeking Data Scientists.

messages.user_query: I wanna becom a data scientist suggest me stuff based on my role
messages.ai_response:
Based on your current role as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer and your goal of becoming a Data Scientist at Adform, here's a plan to help you bridge the skill gap and strengthen your LinkedIn profile.  The Adform job description highlights a need for significant experience (6+ years, with 1 year in a senior role), which is the biggest hurdle.  However, we can strategically address this by focusing on high-impact projects and demonstrably improving your skills.

Your existing foundation in machine learning, Python, and working with large datasets is a strong starting point.  However, to become a competitive candidate, you need to prioritize developing expertise in several key areas:

* **Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Spark):** Hands-on experience processing and analyzing large datasets using these tools is crucial.  Consider online courses (Coursera, edX, DataCamp) and practice using free cloud resources (like Google Cloud Platform or AWS).  Apply this directly to projects – even using publicly available AdTech datasets.

* **Advanced Statistical Modeling & Machine Learning:**  The Adform role requires advanced algorithms for tasks like ad optimization and fraud detection.  Focus on areas like time series analysis and deep learning, particularly as applied to AdTech.  Again, online courses and personal projects using relevant datasets (Kaggle, UCI Machine Learning Repository) are key.  Tailor projects to reflect AdTech challenges (e.g., click-through rate prediction, ad fraud detection).  Incorporate these into your LinkedIn profile, showcasing quantifiable results.

* **Ad Tech Industry Knowledge:**  Familiarize yourself with the AdTech landscape.  Read industry blogs, articles, and white papers; follow key influencers on LinkedIn and Twitter; and attend relevant webinars and events.  This knowledge will significantly strengthen your application.

While Python and SQL are already on your resume, ensure you highlight their advanced usage within the context of big data and AdTech.  Additionally, while not explicitly required, experience with MLOps (deploying and maintaining ML models in production) is highly valuable.

To address the experience gap, actively seek projects involving larger datasets and more complex modeling tasks.  Quantify your achievements rigorously in your updated LinkedIn profile and resume.  Contributing to open-source projects related to AdTech or big data is an excellent way to showcase your skills and build your portfolio.  Consider internships or contract roles in data science within the AdTech industry to gain valuable experience and networking opportunities.

To optimize your LinkedIn profile, incorporate keywords like "Big Data," "Machine Learning Algorithms," "Hadoop," "Scalable Solutions," "Data Pipelines," "Ad-Tech," "Statistical Inference," "Predictive Modeling," and "Fraud Detection" naturally into your summary, experience descriptions, and skills section.  Highlight your teamwork, collaboration, problem-solving, and communication skills with concrete examples.  Remember to emphasize your "senior"-level transferable skills and accomplishments to mitigate the experience gap.

This is a multi-phased approach.  Initially focus on gaining relevant experience (6-12 months), concurrently enhancing your skills in advanced statistical modeling and big data technologies.  Then, over the next 12-18 months, focus on preparing for senior-level roles – refining your resume, practicing behavioral interview questions, and actively networking.  Regularly review and adjust your plan based on your progress and opportunities.  Consistent effort, targeted learning, and strategic networking are key to your success.

messages.user_query: just list them please so I can find or do courses
messages.ai_response:
To reach your Data Scientist goal, especially considering Adform's 6+ year experience requirement, we recommend a phased approach focusing on practical experience and key skills.  Initially, target Data Scientist roles requiring 2-4 years of experience to build your resume.

**High-Priority Learning:**

1. **Big Data Technologies (Hadoop & Spark):**  Mastering Hadoop and Spark is crucial for handling large datasets, a necessity in most Data Scientist roles.  Excellent resources include DataCamp's Hadoop and Spark courses, Udemy courses, and Coursera offerings from top universities.  Aim to complete a comprehensive course within the first two months.  Follow this with a personal project using a public dataset (like those on Kaggle) to demonstrate your ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) skills using tools such as Apache Airflow, Pandas, SQLAlchemy, and a cloud-based data warehouse (e.g., Google BigQuery or AWS Redshift).

2. **Advanced Machine Learning Techniques:** Build on your existing foundation by focusing on scalable algorithms (distributed ML with Spark, advanced model tuning, ensemble methods).  Courses on Coursera (like Andrew Ng's Machine Learning Specialization) and edX are highly recommended, particularly those focusing on deep learning for large datasets.  Showcase these skills in your portfolio.

**Medium-Priority Learning:**

3. **Advanced Statistical Modeling:**  While gaining practical experience takes precedence, concurrently deepen your knowledge of advanced statistical techniques (time series analysis, Bayesian methods).  DataCamp, Coursera, and edX offer relevant courses.  This can be pursued more intensely after securing an entry-level Data Scientist role.

4. **Ad Tech Domain Knowledge:**  Familiarize yourself with the Ad Tech industry through industry blogs, publications, LinkedIn influencers, and webinars.  Targeted courses, if available, would be beneficial.

**Lower-Priority (but still important):**

5. **Data Pipelines and ETL Processes:**  Strengthen your understanding of data warehousing and ETL tools (Apache Airflow, Informatica) through online courses.  This will be enhanced through your big data project and future work experience.

**Strategic Career Progression:**

Your existing skills in Python, machine learning, NLP, Docker, and AWS are valuable assets.  Actively seek entry-level Data Scientist roles to gain practical experience.  Highlight your NLP project in your LinkedIn profile, emphasizing the relevant technologies used.  Continuously update your profile to reflect your progress.  Networking is key—connect with professionals in the Ad Tech space on LinkedIn to learn about opportunities and gain insights.  Remember, consistent effort and a strategic approach will allow you to overcome the initial experience hurdle and ultimately achieve your goal of a Data Scientist role at Adform or a similar company.
